dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high angle looking out over a well-manicured baseball f carved out of a tropical jungle. A game is currently in progress.

dialogues.speaker: A1 ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: Wearing KANSAS CITY KNIGHTS uniforms, mostly Black and da skinned Dominicans as well as several lighter-skinned Venezuelans (17-22 years old) are set in their positions, for the next pitch. CLOSE ON the pitcher, MIGUEL SANTOS (aka AZГљCAR/SUGAR - lean, Black and handsome). Sweat drips down his face in t oppressive midday heat. He steadies his glove and ball at chest, peeking over at the RUNNER on first base. Miguel l his leg high into the air, rears back his right arm, and the ball toward the plate. THUD! A cloud of dust pops off the CATCHER'S mitt as the slams inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike three! The BATTER lowers his head, helpless in the face of Migue overpowering fastball. FROM THE DUGOUT, Miguel's TEAMMATES CHEER him on. HEAD CO REYES (dark-skinned, 30s) nods approvingly, CLAPS. BEHIND THE HOMEPLATE BACKSTOP, a dozen rookie players als Kansas City uniforms cheer for their team. Two YOUNG PLAY clocking Miguel's pitches look at each others' radar guns read 92 and 93 MPH. As the next batter steps up to the plate, Miguel's catche (18), taps his index finger on his thigh, calling for an fastball. The next pitch is popped up on the infield between first home. Miguel locates the ball, points to the sky, but Jos first baseman, PEDRO BERROA, nearly collide, as the ball between them and the runners reach base safely. B1   FROM THE OBSERVATION TOWER, the ACADEMY'S DIRECTOR, ALVAREZ (light-skinned, late 50s) and several other COACH SCOUTS jot down notes on their clipboards. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C1   ON THE FIELD, Miguel glares at Pedro, who averts his kicks the dirt. Miguel looks in for the sign from Jose, nods, and deliver tight fastball that sends the batter stumbling backwards dirt. Some players LAUGH and heckle the batter. Others point an fingers at Miguel, who greets the batter back to the plat a friendly, but authoritative, grin. He sends in the next pitch and the batter swings right th it, getting nothing but air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEAM (about 35 young men) gather around several table their standard baked chicken and rice lunch. The mood is friendly and playful as players tease each other across t tables. Miguel, sitting with his friends MARCOS (2nd base ALFONSO (3rd Base), works on a second helping of dessert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out Sugar... Puts on twenty pounds in two months; now he's going for twenty more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full of food)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All muscle, baby. Rock solid. For some NEW PLAYERS, distinguishable in the sea of BLUE uniforms by their BLACK "tryout" jerseys and ragged sneak is their first healthy meal, and they eat as if it were t last.   One of them, SALVADOR (Black, scrawny, 17) holds plate up to his mouth, shovelling food down his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, kid, it ain't going nowhere. A few of the guys LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pedro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hustled half as much as him, maybe you'd be hungry too. The other guys "ohhhh" Miguel's insult, as Salvador and M exchange subtle grins. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids crowd around in a circle, repeating after the animat English instructor, SEГ‘OR SANCHEZ, who goes over some En BASEBALL TERMS in the center. As he repeats the terms, he enthusiastically pantomimes the meanings of each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fly ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fly ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Line drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Line drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hone rone! CLOSE ON Miguel, repeating the strange words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, and most of the team sits around an old TV set watching the climactic final scene of Field of Dreams dub Spanish. Kevin Costner asks his father to play catch in a that sounds nothing like Kevin Costner. Miguel passes through the room, and we follow him out of room down a hall, and into...

dialogues.speaker: THE WEIGHT ROOM
dialogues.text: ...where he sits down at the bench press, lowers his head thought. TRACK IN CLOSE as he crosses himself, mouths a p then leans back onto the bench. TRACK OUT as he lifts the bar, and begins a set of presse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kansas City Director of Minor League Operations, RUDY HUBBARD (white, 40s), watches a TRYOUT SESSION, where TWO TEENS in worn street clothes pitch to uniformed catchers. AGENT talks on a cell phone nearby. Alvarez, the academy director, approaches one of the kids whispers in his ear. The kid smiles tentatively. Alvarez joins Rudy and they speak in English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him to grip the ball more gently. Like a tit. They both crack up. FROM THE TRYOUT MOUND. The kid looks over to the two men wowing about him. He breathes in, nervous...

dialogues.speaker: BATTING CAGE
dialogues.text: Pedro, sweating hard, takes a few cuts, but only seems to hitting weak ground balls and foul tips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro Berroa. Third year.     Hasn't developed like we hoped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much he sign for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. These kids keep getting more expensive. How much did you sign for back in the day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3000.   When I was fifteen. Rudy smiles and moves on.    Alvarez follows.   Pedro wat men as they walk away.

dialogues.speaker: BULL PEN MOUNDS
dialogues.text: Alvarez and Rudy approach a PITCHING COACH instructing Sa Miguel warms up next to him. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     5. ALVAREZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvador Torres. Been practicing with the team for almost a week. Still raw, but he's got a lot of potential. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna sign him? ALVAREZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. Soon. We want to play it low- key, see what his agent says. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you think? ALVAREZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've gotten two offers from other clubs. Agent says they were around a hundred. Rudy raises his eyebrows. ALVAREZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firm) He's good. Rudy looks over to Miguel. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? ALVAREZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel Santos. Great arm. We signed him two years ago for fifteen. Miguel fires in a pitch.    Rudy nods, impressed. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good deal.    He throw any junk? ALVAREZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Sugar! Miguel looks over, sees the American with Alvarez. ALVAREZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us your curve. Miguel nods, nervous, focuses. He pitches.    The ball cu very subtly over the plate for a strike. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.   Mind if I try something? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    6. Miguel looks back to the men. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, kid, do you mind?   May I? Miguel stares blankly at Rudy, not understanding. ALVAREZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Give him the ball. Miguel hands Rudy the ball, and Rudy demonstrates how to a knuckle curve ball, which looks strangely unorthodox, w index finger tucked against the baseball. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spike curve. Gives you more rotation, more movement. (hands Miguel the ball) You try. Miguel struggles to emulate Rudy's grip, so Rudy maneuver fingers into the correct position. Alvarez laughs. ALVAREZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vamos!   Let's go! Pitch it! Miguel looks over to his catcher, Jose. Winds up the next pitch, and soars it 5 feet wide of the mark. Rudy and Alvarez laugh.   Miguel looks back over his shou RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, son, these things take time. You'll figure it out. Rudy pats Miguel on the back and walks off with Alvarez. stares at them hard as they go. He turns back to his catc determined, squeezes the ball in spike curve formation. Delivers. Misses badly again. JUMP CUTS take us through a half-doze bad curve attempts, as other players take notice and gath around, some laughing, until... ...finally a perfect curve twists dramatically through th landing centered in Jose's mitt. The other players erupt in amazement, while Miguel stares straight ahead. After a beat, he smiles wide. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sr. Sanchez stands in front of a chalkboard, reading off of a scripted ENGLISH DIALOGUE for the class to repeat. T class' version of the words are jumbled and incomprehensi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your performance in the mound is not as good as last year. What is the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your performance in the mound is not good as last year. What is problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe my mechanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe mechanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to give you a chance.   It is up to you... CLOSE ON Miguel focused on the baseball in his hand. He practices his knuckle curve grip, not participating in th lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to give you a chance.   Is up to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel walks down a dirt road with his duffel bag. He exi past the gate, waving goodbye to the SECURITY GUARD. A10   Beyond the manicured lawns and landscaped gardens o Academy, Miguel passes through the overgrown, undeveloped where neighborhood CHILDREN play among grazing goats. He continues down the dirt road towards a paved highway in t distance, as bachata music fuels the sound track, and car over the following... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick stalks of sugarcane race through the frame. CLOSE O Miguel staring out the bus window. On his way home, he passes... A11   --half-clothed children flying a homemade kite. B11   --a truck of bananas barrelling by with a boy perch C11   --an old man sitting by the street, looking straigh D11   --flaming sugarcane alongside the road. E11   --three children wedged between their parents on a F11   --the tall, wheezing smokestack of the Cristobal Co refinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel hops off the bus with his duffel, climbs the pedes walkway passing over dozens of rusty railroad cars used f transporting sugarcane to the refinery. We PAN Miguel acr the bridge, revealing burning smokestacks in the distance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modest homes line the neighborhood, fashioned from corrug tin, painted in bold colors, no two houses alike. A skinn roams a barren lot. A group of WOMEN with their hair in c sit on crates around a dominoes table. They wave their he to Miguel, who smiles back. Local KIDS play stickball in a trash-strewn clearing with makeshift mitts fashioned from old milk cartons or cardbo They see Miguel and rush toward him as he paces up the bl SHOUTING his name. As Miguel approaches home, he makes eye contact with a gi ERICA (15), buying water from a delivery truck. She smile With the kids still clamoring around Miguel, he stops, un his duffel and hands out some used baseballs. The kids gr balls, then run off to play. Miguel approaches Erica.   She puts down her water bucket Miguel a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, sis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any news about the States? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all you have to say? Miguel helps Erica with the water bucket and walks with h towards their home - a small wooden construction with pee paint and a rusted aluminum roof. On the lot next to thei house, the cinder-block frame of their future home dwarfs others on the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Erica enter the house, where their brother LUI watches an enormous television, which feels incongruous i middle of the tiny, dilapidated home. The reception is st crappy, though. Miguel's grandmother, ABUELA, sits upright on her mattres the corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Abuela. You're looking beautiful. She smiles big at her oldest grandson, opens her arms for Erica sits at the kitchen table, where her schoolbooks la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up my people?   How's the TV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica won't let me watch baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not during American Idol, anyway. Miguel's mother, CARMEN (late 30s) emerges from behind a bed sheet, which acts as a "wall" separating two rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buenas, Miguelito! Do you have any good news for your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to the United States?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet, ma... But I learned how to throw a knuckle curve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knuckle curve? What's that? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUP of KIDS gather at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugar, come out and play!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gathered under the only functioning street lamp, Miguel r back and throws in a swooping curve, that causes the BATT flinch out of the way, as it breaks perfectly over the pl Carmen, Luis and the rest of the barrio ONLOOKERS, "ooooh impressive curve. Miguel notices a group of GIRLS eyeing him from across th street. His eyes stop on one, SOFIA (17). They exchange g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel's family - minus Miguel - watches a soap opera. and Erica are in dialogue with the TV. The CAMERA PANS away from the family, out the back window the new home is being constructed. We ZOOM IN on the stru covered in plastic tarp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst tools, dry cement, a half-finished wooden dining t and other assorted construction materials, Miguel has sex Sofia on a work table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel throws on his t-shirt. Sofia looks at the wooden d table. It's artfully done, with details etched into the l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will you finish this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon.   It's just hard to find the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to match the chairs my dad made, but I can't get it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think it's perfect. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   11. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make you another when I'm done. Sofia smiles, kisses Miguel on the cheek. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the rest of the house?   How long till it's done? Miguel hesitates. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, another month, maybe two... You know we just did it where Abuela's room is going to be... SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Don't tell me that! MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? We can do it in mom's kitchen next. Right over there. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting serious) I hope you make it to the States this year. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hope? C'mon, there's nobody better, baby. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling big) Okay, how about: I KNOW you'll make it. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talkin'. And when I do, I'll buy a Cadillac, drive it through the ocean, and bring you back with me. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't drive a Cadillac on water. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! In the States they make cars that drive on water. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see who's crazy.   Just watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the snow.   Does it snow in Kansas City?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But I'll take you to New York City. Yankee Stadium. It snows there. You wanta see me play in Yankee Stadium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't snow during baseball season, silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'll go for Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next Christmas, we'll sail into Yankee Stadium in my Cadillac car-boat. Deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are crazy! They kiss. 19   EXT. MALECГ“N - NIGHT Miguel, Sofia, JAVIER (Black, 22) JAMIE (Black, 26) and ALEXANDRA (one of Sofia's friends) hang out by the malecГ (waterside), drinking rum and dancing to merengue that bl out the open doors of a nearby car. The mood is festive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mid-story)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked her, but she asked me to cut my hair. I thought about it. She was cute, but... I liked my hair more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked it too, Javi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why'd you cut it last week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was time for a new look. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a new girl. Sofia punches Miguel in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it, baby, that's a million-dollar arm you're messing with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right!    All hail the golden arm. Javier and the girls drunkenly salute Miguel's arm, prete dust dirt away, but Jaime doesn't play along. He looks on little jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call that flabby rubberband an arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This flabby rubberband can throw 95. What can yours do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I threw 98 in double-A Portland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98? Then why you washing windshields now? I saw you try and bumrush Javy at the stoplight last week. Everyone cracks up laughing, including Jaime, as Miguel g Sofia, and leads her in a dance. His smile fading, Jaime looks out over the water.   Migue notices this. Hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 Various Sunday morning images establishing Miguel's homet --A dewey mist covers an empty baseball field, surrounded acres of tall sugarcane. --Women hang laundry on the line to dry. --A rooster walks alone through a graveyard. --People spill out of church into the road. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --MIDDLE-AGED MEN drink beer in the dugout during a softb game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A makeshift diamond is overrun with weeds, ditches, stone trash for bases. Donkeys graze in the outfield, unphased LITTLE KIDS (10-14 years old) playing around them. A YOUNG PITCHER fires in a fastball that BEANS the YOUNG in the back. IN THE BLEACHERS, TWO MIDDLE-AGED MEN drink beer and occasionally heckle the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to aim for the head! Nearby, Miguel sits beside his old coach, FRANK (early 40 watching the kids play. One of the local SHOE SHINE BOYS Miguel's shoes with an old toothbrush as Frank cracks ope beer. Frank points out one of the kids on the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this one. Good bat speed. Only twelve years old, out here four, five hours everyday. His mom tells me he's missing school. I say, yeah, but... have you seen his swing? They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm showing his older brother to the Yankees on Monday. Miguel nods, a hint of disappointment in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know what they missed with you. It's cool though. They'll be knocking on your door, offering millions when you turn into a superstar. You'll see... Miguel nods, appreciating the vote of confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been to New York? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   15. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Nothing like playing for a crowd of New Yorkers. They're even louder than Dominicans. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the city like? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great. But you need to get to Kansas City before you start thinking about New York. Know what I mean? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear anything about spring training yet? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Frank sips his beer. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And? Frank shrugs, as Miguel's sister calls out from the stree ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel, Luis! Dinner is ready! MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd tell me if you knew. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Miguel shakes his head, gets up. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna join us for dinner? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight. But give your mom a kiss for me, okay? Miguel gives a coin to the boy who's been cleaning his sh before heading off with his little brother. Frank sips his beer, calls out to the field-- FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Nelson! Fire it in, baby! Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mist hovers over the empty field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of Academy EMPLOYEES shuffle down the dirt road o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel, laying awake in the upper bed, hears his bunk-mat Alfonso, stirring beneath him. Miguel peers over, sees Al discreetly pop several pills from a plastic baggy. They m brief eye contact before Alfonso heads out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several middle-aged women sit on buckets near an open doo peeling yucca. A man fries eggs at the grill, preparing breakfast for the players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players eat breakfast.     The mood is strangely quie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The signed players sit around in uniform, while the unsig "trial" players wear their black jerseys. Coach Reyes add them in mid-speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of you are thinking about your families right now. Your girlfriends, sisters and brothers, grandparents. You're feeling the pressure. But, I'm going to tell you something very important, gentlemen... forget it. You've got to think about yourselves. Put all your energy into your game, into your development as a player. Forget about everything else in your life... and just play ball. You wanna succeed, you gotta be like a racehorse, focused on your goal. It's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several players work out on bars attached to the side of building. As Miguel lowers himself after a set of pull-ups, he noti shiny, black, luxury SUV drive into the academy parking l Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel watches as Alvarez gets out of the driver's seat, business on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel exercises his pitching arm by stretching an elasti tied against a chain-link fence. As he stretches, he watc group of players line up for a sprint drill, sizing up hi future competition. Salvador, wearing his black jersey, races for his life, b all the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sweat-drenched players line up according to their pos waiting their turns to participate in a double-play drill the pitchers cover first base. Miguel awaits his turn, watching another pitcher, EDDY, r first to receive a throw from second base, but before Edd catch the ball... ...he twists his ankle tripping over the bag. The coaches rush over to Eddy, who is on the ground winci pain. Miguel and the rest of the team watch in nervous anticipation as Eddy struggles to his feet, limps off the with the aid of another player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next up, Miguel! Here we go! The ball is hit on the ground to first base, where the fi quickly throws it over to second. Miguel charges over to stutter steps as he nears the base, and receives the thro in time to beat the hitter and step out of the way. He ex in relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players shower after a gruelling day of workouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel lounges with an elaborate ice-wrap around his shou and upper arm as other players get dressed into street cl Coach Reyes comes in, spots Pedro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berroa, see Alvarez when you're dressed. Pedro nods.   Miguel and Marcos exchange knowing glances. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team eats dinner.    At Miguel's table, we catch the of a joke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the Dominican's like, `Fuck, what am I gonna do?' He stays there, points up to the sky and says. `Look! There's a plane... Right THERE!' Everyone laughs hysterically, as... ...the young rookie, Salvador, grabs a seat next to Migue adjoining table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sugar!    They made me an offer. Miguel smiles, but hesitates for a beat as Pedro walks pa and over to an empty table in the corner of the room. Mig turns back to Salvador, pats him on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. Congratulations.     How much they offer you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a big smile)
(sensing the other players surprise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you know, my manager's taking, like, forty of it... What'd you sign for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, more or less the same. Did you get any other offers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yankees and Seattle, but not as much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't get cocky. No one likes a dickhead... Welcome to the team. Salvador smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why do they call you Sugar? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's like this... it started cause I'm sweet with the ladies. But mostly it's cause I got the sweetest knuckle curve in the whole Republic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interjecting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! You just learned that shit on Friday! It's cause he eats so much junk food! Salvador notices two pieces of cake on Miguel's tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing it cool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just jealous. Miguel notices Pedro across the room, staring at his food

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen players sit around the television, watching a shl American horror film on DVD.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ADJOINING DORMITORY
dialogues.text: Pedro packs his belongings into a KC Knights' duffel bag, Miguel, Marcos, and Alfonso approach his bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got you a going away present. Miguel unzips his windbreaker to reveal a bottle of Bruga hidden underneath. The other guys smile mischievously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel, Marcos, Alfonso, and Pedro tip-toe across the gra whispering at each other to shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four players toast their rum in little plastic cups. bottle is nearly finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should try Los Campos. I heard the Dodgers could use a new first baseman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that. The coaches are even tougher over there. I'm done, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     20. PEDRO (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more curfews, nobody tellin' me what to do and how to do it. For real, I'm glad this shit's over. I'm a free man. Awkward silence. The players look at Pedro with pity, uns how to respond. After a beat, Miguel mocks coach Reyes an others follow suit, mocking Alvarez and the other coaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snatching Pedro's cap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No caps indoors, son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the meat with your knife; eat the meat with your fork. NEVER eat the meat with your knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you'll chop off your tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten p.m. lights out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in broken English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tay me outta the ball game, tay me outta the crowd..." The other players laugh, join Pedro in a loud whisper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...buys me so peanut and crackay- yacks. I doe-care if I never get back. Roo, roo, roo for home teams, we doe- win is a shame..." Pedro breaks off from the song, looks out over the field, verge of crying. One by one, the other players take notic stop singing. Silence. Hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungover, Miguel vomits in the toilet.    Reyes opens the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santos, what the hell's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I have the flu, coach.    I can't pitch today. Reyes glances over to Marcos and Alfonso standing nearby. lower their heads in embarrassment like two kids busted b Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got five minutes to get out on that mound, Santos. Reyes marches off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel on the mound. Takes a deep breath. He utilizes eve ounce of strength to deliver a pitch, and... CRACK! The visiting Detroit Academy HITTER knocks the bal the left field wall for a homerun, wherein... BLAH! Miguel throws up on the mound.   All the players ga disgust, but Reyes just laughs. Miguel looks over to Alvarez, sitting under an umbrella w clipboard, then to Reyes, hoping he'll yank him out of th but Reyes just claps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel better now? Let's go! Miguel tries to shake off the cobwebs, steps on the rubbe stares down the next hitter. CLOSE on his hand revealing the knuckle curve grip. He to in the next pitch, which arcs into Jose's glove for a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike! Reyes' smile fades, stunned by the beautiful curve. A SERIES OF JUMPCUTS take us through the next three batte Miguel makes quick work of them, mixing up his nasty curv a blazing fastball. After the third out, Miguel walks back to the dugout. a seat on the bench, smiles smugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wipe that smile off your face. And he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel, Alfonso, and Marcos run laps around the field as punishment for the previous night's activities. They look they could pass out at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Marcos sit on a couch in a bare-walled waiting outside Alvarez's office. They sit quietly, like two kids waiting for the principal. Coach Reyes pokes his head out of Alvarez's office, motio inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Marcos stare straight ahead, nervously.   Alva stares at them, icy cold. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very disappointed. Just when I was starting to like you guys, you go and do something stupid. What do you have to say for yourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Alfonso was there too--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --No excuses. This is unacceptable behavior. You guys need to learn discipline. Miguel and Marcos lower their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to remember that you still have a long way to go, a lot of hard work ahead of you before you make it. First, there's getting your shot in the American Minor Leagues: rookie ball, single, double, triple A - all that before you even set foot in a major league ballpark. So, you better pull it together quick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because nobody's gonna take this shit from a couple Dominican rookies when you go to the U.S. for Spring Training this season. They glance up, eyes wide.   Did he just say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been invited to Spring Training. Everyone smiles (even Alvarez). Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA follows behind the FLOOR MANAGER, as he passes row WOMEN of all ages, working on sewing machines for an Amer underwear company. He stops behind one woman, taps her on shoulder. The woman removes her earphones, turns around. Miguel's mother, Carmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone call.    He said it's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmen picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hold on her reaction shifting from that of concern to ela She struggles to contain her joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel opens a new bottle of rum, pours shots for everyon whole family and all of Miguel's neighbors are jammed ins tiny house and spilling out into the street. Merengue bla from the new home stereo system. FRIENDS and FAMILY pat Miguel on the back. He smiles, bas in the glory of success. Erica kisses Miguel on the cheek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget to call everyday.    I want to know everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean, dummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'll be calling to keep you in check, make sure your grades don't slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's talking. Carmen interrupts, drapes her arms around Miguel, kissing repeatedly. As Erica looks on, we get the sense that she' to being on the outside of this kind of attention. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      24. CARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my hero! Carmen pulls Miguel close, takes something from her pocke it in his hand. CARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was your father's.     I want you to take it with you... Miguel looks at the cross, kisses his mother on the cheek he looks up, he notices Erica slip away. CARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been   given a wonderful gift, Miguelito.    And God willing, you will continue to   do great things with it. I love you so   much. She kisses him on the forehead. A SERIES OF JUMPCUTS present a variety of family and frie introducing themselves to Miguel. UNCLE ANGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguelito! You gonna remember your uncle Angel when you're all big and famous? Don't forget your family, kid. Never forget where you came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COUSIN LUPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupe! Cousin Lupe! Remember that time we went skinny-dipping at the MalecГіn? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COUSING FELIPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were eight years old! Hated the goats so much. You would cry and cry and cry and cry. What a baby you were. Do you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07        25. AUNT LOLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola!   Your aunt Lola!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNCLE JEFFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Jeffe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEIGHBOR ANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your neighbor Ana. I grew up around the corner from here. Ana lays a juicy kiss on Miguel.   He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me any shit, kid.      I taught you everything you know. Miguel gives Frank a big hug. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm damn proud of you, kid.    Your father would be, too. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.    I owe it all to you. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all.   Just forty percent. Miguel smiles, as Frank leans close. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent the best years of my life playing in the States. Life gives you a lot of opportunities, but baseball only gives you one. Enjoy every minute of it. Miguel nods. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your new curve? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty sweet. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Here... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hands Miguel a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your autograph. Miguel seems puzzled, but searches for something to write

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kidding, you arrogant prick. It's so you can write your family... and me, too... if you feel like it. Miguel gives Frank another hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel dances salsa with Sofia, and then switches partner dances with Carmen. As he dances close with his mother, he catches a glimpse Erica standing with some friends off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Erica stand in silhouette, isolated from the p raging outside. Miguel sands one of the legs of the dinin table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know; the ugly one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, where's Hector?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some other party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what about the good-looking one? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, Fernando... I think he's out there dancing with Sofia. Miguel's eyes get big for a second, until Erica smiles. been had. He smiles back. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you, sis. You're going to do great things too. We all know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna miss you... She kisses Miguel on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, I'll be out in a minute. And tell Fernando to keep his dirty hands off my girl. Through cracks in the tarp, Miguel watches Erica join the party in the street. Savoring this rare moment alone, he breathes deep, blows dust off the table leg, and continues sanding. Hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel looks out the window over the dry, Arizona desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A duffel bag emerges from the luggage shoot, and slides d the rotating conveyor belt, where an AMERICAN TOURIST gra and exits frame. PAN OVER to Miguel, Marcos and several o DOMINICAN PLAYERS (including ANTONIO and JULIO) excitedly waiting for their bags. Miguel perks up upon seeing his, quickly snatches it off the belt. The others smile and AP

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. AIRPORT SHUTTLE BUS
dialogues.text: The other Dominican players goof off, while Miguel stares the windows at the rocky suburban Phoenix landscape. He c wide-eyed glimpses of wacky shaped cacti, strip malls, an course, a drive-thru Starbucks. ON THE RADIO, a conservative talk show host warns listene about the evils of Iran, suggests war as the only solutio Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players enter the southwest-style lobby, examining po cacti, and framed R.C. Gorman reprints on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Marcos enter the room, drop their bags and exp everything like big kids away from home for the first tim Marcos turns on the TV, which has a clear reception.    H IN THE BATHROOM Miguel examines the hair dryer on the wal turns it on and off. KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK. Miguel opens the adjoining suite door find Antonio and Julio. They push past him, each holding beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out. Antonio opens their mini bar, tosses Miguel and Marcos be They all toast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To America! Marcos randomly hits buttons on the remote control and accidentally selects an adult pay-per-view movie. The ope credits plunge right into a graphic sex-scene. Their head immediately jerk over to the TV, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To America! They all smile and toast again.

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK
dialogues.text: Marcos opens the door to find JORGE RAMIREZ (25, an exper minor leaguer who left the KC Knights Dominican camp thre ago) smiling before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up fellas!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge! They hug.   Jorge enters, notices the beers and porn.   H his head. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window we see the players sitting in a corner A semi truck BLASTS through the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over beers, the players study their menus in confusion, a does his best to explain how things work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never, never, never, drink from the hotel mini bar. That shit is expensive. You want beer, buy it at the store. You wanta see titties? They got magazines for that. Don't pay in the hotel. A WAITRESS approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The greatest thing about the States? You can order breakfast 24/7. French toast is the best. It's nothing like Dominican toast. (in English to waitress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French toast please. The players stare at Jorge, a little intimidated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's next? After a beat, the players respond in unison...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French toast. The waitress nods and leaves, wherein the players crack u laughing at their first English language dining experienc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM THE OBSERVATION TOWER, we look down over the multipl spring training complex, where the MINOR LEAGUERS work ou vast facilities are triple the size of what we saw in the Dominican Republic. A55   ON THE FIELD, Miguel, Marcos, and Jorge stretch out grass. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    30. Jorge, wearing an elastic knee brace, points out a young, AFRICAN-AMERICAN GUY running wind sprints across the fiel JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad Johnson. He just signed for a million dollars out of college. Miguel and Marcos watch Brad with fascination, searching some sort of physical representation of his wealth. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot of guys like that. But you can't let that intimidate you. Everyone knows Dominicans rule the game. Two Venezuelan players, ORLANDO MATO (23, catcher) and ED (22, center field) step up. ORLANDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this about Dominicans ruling the game? ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he must've said Venezuelans. Jorge stands up, exchanges hugs with Orlando and Ed as th continue their debate over which Latin country has the be players. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy, Manny, Pedro... ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santana, Zambrano, the Guillens! JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys all from the same family? ORLANDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's talking... Are these your brothers? JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, all Dominicans look the same, now? They all smile, stop razzing each other momentarily to me new players. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Miguel and Marcos. Up from Boca Chica. (to Miguel and Marcos) (MORE) Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    31. JORGE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando and Ed. We all played in Bridgetown together before I moved up to Double A and left these fools behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you couldn't hang in Wichita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I injured my knee, asshole.    But I'm healthy now. You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks you're back in Iowa next month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks you're still an asshole next month. They all LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: Pitching coach, STU SUTTON (white, 40s), addresses the mi league pitching staff in mid-speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta show us your best game here. Remember that, until you reach the top, there's always guys above you, hustling to keep you here. And guys below you pushing to take your job. We have 75 pitchers in this camp competing for less than 50 positions come April 3rd. So you gotta work hard... While all the players respectfully listen to Stu, it is c that very few of the Latino players can understand him.

dialogues.speaker: LATER ON THE PRACTICE MOUNDS
dialogues.text: Miguel stretches his arm, while observing another group o PITCHERS throwing in the bullpen. He stares at them with intensity, sizing up his new competition.

dialogues.speaker: LATER ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: Miguel faces off against a HITTER in a simulated game sce One, two, three, he strikes him out on three straight pit Stu and another COACH exchange impressed looks. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring over Leonard. The other Coach calls over to the adjoining field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring over Leonard!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: ON major league all-star ROB LEONARD in the batter's box, awaiting Miguel's pitch. Miguel takes a deep breath, psyches himself up. He puts everything he has into a hearty fastball, which... ...sails right over the plate for a STRIKE, as Leonard ca watches and readies himself for the next one. Feeling confident with his stuff, Miguel fires in the nex pitch, and... WHACK!   Leonard sails it over the right field wall. Stu Sutton smiles at Miguel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to America, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a plate of french toast. Miguel, Marcos, Antonio Julio all chow down on french toast again. They eat in si for a few beats, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to admit... I'm getting a little sick of the french toast. The others nod in agreement, but continue eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel talks on the phone to Sofia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pitched against Rob Leonard today. A61   We INTERCUT with Sofia, at her home in the Dominica

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit!   You strike him out? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    33. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar! MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me? SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got one strike at least. Sofia laughs. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you like it there? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm...    It's different. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different how? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Just different.     Like the food is really sweet. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you liked sweet things. Miguel smiles. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the players are really good. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not like you. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not like me. Of course not... But they're pretty good. Another beat.    Sofia looks down at her bare feet, scrun toes. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you, too. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcos tries to sleep, while Miguel channel surfs through late night infomercials and reality TV dating shows. After a few beats of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off. And he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel runs laps along the outfield wall in the empty sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kansas City B-squad is facing off against the Los Ang squad, which is rallying in the top of the 9th.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Miguel warms up, glancing over to the action on the field between pitches. He sees... ...Los Angeles gets another hit, scoring another run, so. ...Stu Sutton walks out to the mound, signals for Miguel. Miguel throws one more warm-up toss and sprints onto the

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOUND
dialogues.text: Miguel arrives, ready for action.   Stu hands him the bal the catcher, Orlando, translates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax. Know your pitches. And take it easy. Ground ball. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax. Ground ball. Miguel nods. As he tosses a few more warm-up pitches from mound, Stu goes back to the DUGOUT where Marcos and Julio anxiously await Miguel's spring training game debut. The BATTER steps in and Miguel steps on the rubber, touch father's cross around his neck, tucks it in his jersey. H looks to Orlando, and nods at his request for a fastball. throws it in... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike! Stu exchanges impressed glances with another COACH. Miguel sends in the next one, and... ...the HITTER checks his swing, but goes too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two! IN THE DUGOUT Marcos gets to his feet, clapping for encouragement. Miguel nods to Orlando, delivers again... CRACK! The ball is smoked toward Brad Johnson at second b He leaps out, body fully extended, and makes a fantastic But he's not done yet... The runner at second is too far off the bag, so Brad hops feet, and fires a laser beam to second, finishing off one sweetest double-plays you'll ever see. Miguel pumps his fist into the air, and the team runs to.

dialogues.speaker: THE DUGOUT
dialogues.text: Marcos and Julio are the first to greet Miguel with high- Orlando, Ed, and Jorge, coming off the field, follow in s Miguel awaits Brad's return to the dugout and high-fives too, but they soon return to their segregated places on o ends of the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the players are gone or heading out when Miguel approaches his catcher, Orlando, a few lockers away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you learn English so good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back home in Caracas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like in high school, or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's still hard though. People talk fast. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel agrees, as an ASSISTANT COACH finishes handing out to the remaining players. Miguel sits on the bench near his locker, opens his envel find... INSERT:   a check for $502.18. He SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENGLISH INSTRUCTOR goes over baseball related vocabul screen, while Miguel glances through his "English for Bas Players" notebook. He finds a page with pictures of different foods along wi their English names. He looks at all the foods, stops at image of a fried egg. He circles the word "egg." The instructor finishes up class, and the exhausted Latin players get up to leave. Marcos stands, leans over to Mig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.    Let's grab some dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'm gonna stay and work out a little. I'll catch up later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel does bicep curls alone in the weight room, when... ...Brad Johnson enters. They exchange hello gestures, and proceed to workout on opposite sides of the room. After finishing his set, Miguel turns to Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... I got lucky. They continue with their respective routines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Miguel's hands counting out seven fifty-dollar b He approaches the CLERK behind thick, bullet-proof glass, slides the money and routing slip through a retractable t Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles BIG at the clerk.      Proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual waitress hovers over Miguel, alone at the usual

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French toast, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...   Egg.    Egg, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs. No problem. How would you like'm? Miguel stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, okay, uh... Scrambled?       Over easy? Sunny side up? A beat... He didn't count on this part.      He thinks ha pressure mounting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving up, embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No eggs?   You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, honey. French toast it is. As she leaves, Miguel shakes his head, dejected.       St window. A72   MINUTES LATER. The waitress returns with french toa another plate with samples of different eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... This is scrambled.       Scrambled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrambled. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing on plate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (and finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's tricky... Sunny-side-up. Sunny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunny side up... On the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. Miguel gets to work on his food, feeling good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel leans against the wall, eyes closed.    He whisper prayer to himself, then heads inside the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where he passes a dejected-looking Antonio, on his way Antonio avoids eye contact, and Miguel understands what's happened. He sees Marcos, Julio, and a few other players lingering the bulletin board. He approaches, cautiously. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sending Antonio back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.   What about you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're staying here.   Rookie ball. Miguel nervously glances over to the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go take a look. Miguel goes to the board scans the names on a roster, fin INSERT:   We PAN from his name to "(A) Bridgetown, Iowa"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not with you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight to Single A, bro.     With Jorge. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Iowa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various images of vast Midwest farmlands... corn country. Miguel looks out the window at the passing landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridgetown's number one baseball fans, EARL HIGGINS (70) wife HELEN HIGGINS (also 70) watch as the bus pulls into depot. They're holding a sign that says: "Miguel Santos # About a dozen young players hop off the bus and grab thei Some of them jump into waiting taxis, but Miguel sees his on the Higgins' sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't I stay with you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Sugar. The Higgins are good people. I stayed with them last time I played here. Jorge walks over towards the Higgins with Miguel. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't you stay with them again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a no girls policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge! Good to see you back in Bridgetown! Jorge hugs Helen, shakes hands with Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.   This is Miguel. Orlando whistles to Jorge from a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go now.    Take care of my friend. Jorge waves goodbye to the Higgins, pats Miguel on the ba hops in a cab with Orlando and Ed. Awkward beat, as Miguel, Earl, and Helen stand in silence

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. HIGGINS CAR
dialogues.text: Earl and Helen ramble on in English, while Miguel spaces back window at the passing corn stalks, which are strikin similar to the sugar cane stalks back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had Dominicans, Venezuelan boys, a Colombian, one from Panama, blacks and some Americans. Mostly Spanish boys, though. Johan Santana, Mendy Lopez and Ramon Martinez all stayed with us. Years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last year we had this boy, Junior Sanchez. Nice boy. Decent with the glove, but couldn't bunt to save his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-for-twelve in sacrifice situations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cost the team at least two victories. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's being generous!   I'd say four or five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel, Earl, and Helen enter the old, crickety home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your things down.   I'll show you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the kitchen. Help yourself to whatever you'd like. You can make a list of special foods you like to eat and put it here. Helen points to a grocery list tucked under a broccoli ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and over here, this drawer is a little funny. She pulls open the silverware drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be careful or... She pulls it a little too far and it falls off its rail. nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the washer and the dryer. For your clothes. You put the soap in this one. Sopa. Miguel looks at her, confused.   Did she just say "soup"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other one's just hot air. Caliente.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel follows Helen up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your room is up here. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in bad Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El banyo. She laughs.   Miguel smiles, appreciating the effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your new cuarto. Bedroom. Do with it as you please. Just no girls. Chicas? No chicas. Miguel smiles, understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl and Helen break down the rules for Miguel at the tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No drinking. No cervezas in the casa. No chicas in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told him that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.     What about quiet time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. There's no real curfew, but you must be quiet after ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diez. (holding index finger to mouth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh... after diez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten.     Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si! That's all we ask. It's our job to keep you healthy and focused on baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we take pride in that. Miguel smiles. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen brings a large glass of lemonade to Miguel gently s on the porch swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She nods, looks out over the landscape, and for the first we see... ...an EXTREME WIDE SHOT of the Higgins house, which seems situated in the middle of nowhere. The low sun casts a dr Days of Heaven glow over the image. A tiny Helen Higgins returns inside the house, while Miguel continues to sway porch swing, alone. Hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmen talks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is so proud, Miguelito.   It's all we can talk about. A85   We INTERCUT between Carmen and Miguel IN HIS NEW IO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. And Victor? Can he start construction on the house again? I'll be sending money every two weeks now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just paid him. He's coming next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? You get something for yourself like I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   What do I need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, mom... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't get anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I got some new shoes, but I'm not telling. Erica strolls by, yells into phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three pairs, Miguel!    But who's counting? Miguel laughs on his end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel!   Time for dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go, mom. The lady is calling me. Smells like dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner? Don't forget who your real mother is, Miguelito. Are you going to prefer her cooking to mine now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible... I love you, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone loves and misses you.      Strike one out for me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: INT. HIGGINS DINING ROOM- DUSK
dialogues.text: The Higgins' son, MICHAEL (40s), and his wife, HILARY (40 their daughter, ANNE (17), join Earl and Helen for Miguel first dinner in Iowa. Helen leads the table in grace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Lord... Thank you for the meal we are about to eat. And for blessing us with our new guest. And guiding him safely on his journey from the Dominican Republic to Bridgetown... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     45. Miguel glances around the table.   Everyone's head is bow eyes closed. His eyes stop on Anne, seated across from him. She's an attractive all-American girl, but would never dream of fl her good looks. After taking her in, Miguel closes his ey HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And finally, Lord... Please look kindly over the Swing this season. May all the players stay healthy and... well, why not?... if there's anything you can do to help us win another championship, we'll take that too... Amen. The table laughs, followed by a chorus of Amens. Miguel o his eyes, greeted with smiles. He smiles too, as everyone passes dishes around the table. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Miguel... Do - you - eat - meatloaf - back home? HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you, Michael, he doesn't speak any English. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but... I'm curious to know what he thinks of the meatloaf. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care?   You didn't cook it. HILARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) I doubt they have meatloaf in the Dominican Republic, dear. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet they have something similar. They probably just have another name for it. All eyes are on Miguel as he nervously takes a bite. A suspenseful beat, until... ...he smiles and nods. Everyone sighs, smiles, and nods back. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good old-fashioned American home cooking, Miguel. Welcome to America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like.   Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, very good, Miguel. De nada to you, mi amigo. De nada to you. Anne smiles at Miguel, a little embarrassed by her grandp Miguel smiles back, then gets back to his meatloaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team's CLUBHOUSE MANAGER (19, redheaded freckle face) out schedules to a handful of returning players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you guys ever need tickets for family or friends, just let me know two days ahead of time. Thursday's opener is already sold out, but I saved one row, so you need to speak up now... Miguel enters the room, looking for his locker.    The Cl takes notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santos - you're over there. Clubby points Miguel in the right direction, where he fin locker and several pressed jerseys waiting for him. Migue takes his practice jersey, sits down in front of the lock as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in bad Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Que pasa, hermano? Brad pats Miguel on the back.    Miguel is excited to see familiar face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in bad English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up, Flaco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I was totally psyched when I saw your name on the squad. Good times. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Brad finds his locker, and they both suit up.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. UNDERGROUND CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: We follow Miguel through the tunnel, which leads out to t

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGETOWN SWING BALL PARK FIELD
dialogues.text: A stunning little park that sits at the Mississippi River edge, underneath the Crescent Bridge. A dozen scattered p warm up on the lush green grass. A wide-eyed Miguel steps onto the field for the first tim takes it all in. Hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Jorge stroll through the mall. Miguel notes th steady barrage of discount signs, plastic jewelry kiosks, product samples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel follows Jorge through the men's section when a rac Hanes underwear catches his eye. He turns a package over. INSERT: in a little corner of the package Miguel reads, " THE DOMINICAN REPUBLIC". He checks the price tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, bro, let's find you a suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't afford a suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say buy a suit. I said find a suit. So when you make it big, you'll already know what looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel emerges from the dressing room in a white suit and electric blue collared shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot damn!   That's what's up! Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       48. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it? JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it!   You look like an all-star, bro. Miguel admires himself in the mirror. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a fake announcer voice, in English) "Starting pitcher for American League... from Kansas City... Miguel... 'Sugar'... Santos." Jorge fakes massive crowd applause.   Miguel laughs. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, man?   You try one. Jorge shrugs, smiles. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   Nah... I'm all washed up. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... Jorge gets distracted by a pack of TEENAGE GIRLS cruising They smile at the players, who smile back. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. You have no idea. Just wait till we go to Big Muddy's. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Muddy's? Jorge reaches into his wallet, removes his ID, hands it t Miguel. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be 21 to drink there. This is my old license. They won't know the difference. Miguel looks at Jorge's ID photo, cracks up. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? Nobody's gonna believe I'm this ugly fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me; they won't know the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Jorge each carry a shopping bag for Helen. Mig also carries a plastic bag of his own. All three of them licking ice cream cones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel takes a new calendar out of a plastic shopping bag features iconic images of New York City. He peels off the plastic and pins it to the month of April on his wall. CLOSE ON Miguel's hands tearing open a small package from family back home: we linger on a crudely drawn sketch of baseball player with a Kansas City jersey from Luis, alon a photo of Carmen, Erica, and Luis posing in front of the of the new house. Miguel smiles, reads the enclosed letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening Night. There's an air of excitement in the stands on the field. The small park's seats are packed with fans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK JEFFERIES (White, 50s) overlooks the field, speaks i microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Swing fans, welcome to another exciting season of Swing baseball. As always we've got some new faces who we'll get to know this year-- like Brad Johnson, the highly touted 2nd baseman out of Stanford. He'll make his professional debut tonight. Great night for Swing baseball... And also a great night to grab a bite and a brew at Harlow's after the game - your local pub and proud sponsor... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07        50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a YOUNG LADY begins singing the Star-Spangled Banner, takes off his hat, looks out to the American Flag. Hold o solemn expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We STAY ON Miguel for the game's highlights, JUMP CUTTING reactions to the best plays of the game. PLAY 1: he casually spits sunflower seed shells, then CLA final out of the inning, high-fiving players returning to dugout. PLAY 2: chats to Jorge, when they react to the CRACK of t bat, leap to their feet, eagerly anticipate an umpire's c and CHEER when the call goes their team's way. PLAY 3:   grimaces at the sight of a hit-by-pitch. PLAY 4:   leaps to his feet, CLAPS. PLAY 5:   leaps to his feet, doesn't clap.   Sits back do PLAY 6: Miguel and Jorge sway to the seventh inning stret classic "Take Me Out to the Ball Game." PLAY 7: sitting with Brad, they both point to something o field and crack up laughing. Of course, we don't see what they're laughing at. PLAY 8: standing with Jorge and the rest of the players, mood is tense. The players react to a hit ball, as their jerk toward the outfield, waiting, waiting, waiting, and. A98   CELEBRATION! Whatever happened, the game is over an the players out onto the field to mob Brad, who just scor winning run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOUNCER examines Miguel's photo ID, which is actually Jorge's. He shoots Miguel a suspicious look, but hands it and lets him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the Swing players celebrate their first victory w beers at the local bar/dance club. A few of the guys danc LOCAL GIRLS, but Jorge and Miguel stand against the wall, in hand, as they watch the MTV-inspired GRINDING and FREA unfolding before them. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they know how to salsa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it, bro. But remember, just cause they dance with you, doesn't mean they want anything else. Orlando and Ed approach with a couple brews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from you, anyway. Miguel notices Brad stroll by, calls him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo flaco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up fellas?     Good game. They all toast beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the flaco? I mean... (flexing his arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call this flaco? Everyone laughs, as Jorge eyes TWO WOMEN on the dance flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge whispers in one of the girls' ears and the two of t begin dancing with him and Miguel. At first cautious, Mig and his partner ease closer, until Miguel's hands are on hips, leading her in rhythm to the hip-hop jam, while mix some Latin moves as well. As Miguel and Jorge carve and twist with their partners, local bar PATRONS begin to take notice of their fancy foo But Miguel might be dancing too well for one DRUNK JACKAS particular, who... ...wanders over, gets in Miguel's face. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, Paco. This ain't the jungle. Miguel stares him down. A few clubbers in the immediate vicinity stop dancing, observe. Jorge steps between them, and... ...apparently, drunken egos speak the same language every because Jorge and the Jackass start jawing back and forth their native tongues. Both seem to be understanding the o though the MUSIC is too loud to hear anything specific. Brad and the Venezuelans run over to break it up before a serious starts. They all hustle out to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Latin players spill out into the brisk night air with and the Swing's designated hitter, JEFF ELKS. They all pile into Brad's car, as a few locals stand near club's entrance, watching them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls up near the house and Miguel stumbles out, wild bunch inside HOOT and HOLLER. The car backs down the road and the players' voices fade with the hum of the engine. An upstairs light goes on. Miguel looks up to the Higgins bedroom where Helen's silhouetted figure lingers in the w He tiptoes inside. The sound of a CHURCH CHOIR fades in, and carries over to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the exception of Miguel, the all-white congregation hymns about Jesus and the Lord. He tries to suppress a ya when he sees Anne Higgins singing in the choir. She notic him as she sings. A smile. Miguel perks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHURCHGOERS flood out of the church after the service. walks alongside Miguel. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   53.
