dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you like the service? (off his blank stare)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our church? Hope it wasn't too boring for you. Did you go to church in the Dominican Republic? He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry.    I do not understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'okay. You understand more than a lot of folks around here I bet. He nods, still unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So listen, me and some friends   are hanging out later. You should    stop by my house after the game. It's    gonna be super chill. Grandma can take    you there, but here... She stops a random CHURCHGOER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I borrow a pen real quick? The churchgoer hands over a pen, and Anne writes her addr Miguel's forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the game. My house...     Good luck, tonight. Anne runs off.   Miguel looks after her, mystified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-uniformed players hang out, eating sandwiches, passi around a PLAYBOY magazine, signing souvenir baseballs, an talking at full volume. Hip-hop BLASTS from a stereo, com with an old DUKES OF HAZARD rerun on the TV. HARDY, the Bridgetown Swing mascot, passes through with his enormous head under one arm. Miguel sits at his locker, psyching himself up for his fi start. He touches Luis' drawing, which is taped to the in of his locker. Closes his eyes, takes a deep breath. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MOUND. Miguel opens his eyes, as the LEAD-OFF HITT steps into the batter's box. He takes a moment, crosses himself. Play ball. Miguel nods to his catcher, Orlando, then fires in the fi pitch high for a ball. When he gets the ball back, he looks to the stands, where ...Earl, Helen, Michael, and Hilary sit uncomfortably clo the field in choice box seats. He takes a nervous breath, fires in the second pitch. Same for the third. And forth. The batter jogs to first, and the crowd GRUMBLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Jefferies does his thing on the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santos, apparently feeling the butterflies on his first professional outing. Hailing all the way from the Dominican Republic, Santos wowed the club with his power during Spring Training. But he's off to a rocky start tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOUND
dialogues.text: Jorge comes over from third base as the batter walks to f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Sugar. It's the same game we played back home. That's all it is. Just a game, man. So relax. Let's have some fun. Okay? Miguel nods.    Jorge points out the next batter.   Anoth Dominican.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?   Just like home. Jorge runs back to his position at third.   Miguel tucks index finger into his knuckle curve grip.   Delivers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike! Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!   There it is! And the next pitch... ...is hit sharply to Jorge at third, who fires it over to for one, and on to first for a double play. The crowd goes WILD and Miguel finally exhales. One, two, three... he mows down the next BATTER on three consecutive strikes. More APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DUGOUT
dialogues.text: Orlando hands him his first strikeout ball. Miguel takes seat, wipes the sweat from his head, then looks down at A address scribbled on his forearm.

dialogues.speaker: SCOREBOARD
dialogues.text: We PAN RIGHT across six innings of zeroes. The Swing are leading 4 to nothing in the top of the 7th.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: THWACK!   The HITTER smokes a double off the left-center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly unhittable for the first 6 innings, that was only the second hit allowed by Santos tonight. 114   BACK ON THE FIELD. The next BATTER dribbles a spinning groundball at Jorge, squirts through his legs into left field, allowing the ru score an unearned run from second. Stu walks toward the mound, signals for the bullpen.   He Orlando greet Miguel on the mound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good game, kid.   Enjoy this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, Sugar. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish, to Orlando)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that wasn't my fault. I can go longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy; it's your first game. Though he doesn't speak Spanish, Stu knows exactly what's happening. He takes the ball from Miguel with a smile, bu Miguel doesn't move, still reluctant to leave the mound. As the FANS begin to cheer his stellar debut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that? It's for you, kid. Orlando smiles, pats Miguel on the butt, and Miguel final starts his slow walk off the field. As we follow him off, FANS rise to their feet and Miguel approaches the dugout standing ovation. On his way in, he's greeted by his team with congratulatory high-fives. AT THIRD Jorge stares at the dirt, frustrated by his misp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIREWORKS EXPLODE in the sky as the kids in the crowd wat excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DUGOUT
dialogues.text: Miguel and a few other players hang over the railing, enj the awesome display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel rings the doorbell, waits.   He's holding a baseba Anne opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Miguel.    C'mon inside. He hands her the ball like it's a rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in rehearsed English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first... strike-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Miguel... you're so sweet. Congratulations, I heard you pitched awesome. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of casual teenage party is in effect. Pizza box spread around the living room and everyone (12-15 WHITE K are drinking soda from plastic cups. No booze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey everybody, this is Miguel. He's from the Dominican Republic, and now he pitches for the Swing. Everyone manages to say "Hi Miguel" at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: GAME ROOM
dialogues.text: Two guys, RANDY and TRAVIS, play a spirited game of fooze while Miguel looks on, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like soccer. You play soccer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soccer?   No. Baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this is called fooze-ball.   Fooze- ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foos-ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you got it. Miguel looks for Anne, sees her going over some papers wi another kid. She sees Miguel, waves, then gets back to he conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be a pitcher. In little league. I wasn't very good though. Miguel nods, and another girl, WENDY, chimes in. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that the beaches in the Dominican Republic are really beautiful. Miguel nods again. They stand in silence for an awkward b sipping from their red, plastic cups, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys, let's get started.   Everyone grab a seat. The teens crowd into the living room, squeezing together sofas, recliners, and desk chairs. Miguel sits behind the majority of the group, not sure what's going on. Anne sta before them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you all came. Last year, we didn't have half as many people in our group. So, I think this just goes to show the great work we've been doing in spreading the word. But this year, I want us to work harder. Now, I know a lot of you are studying for SATs or working on college applications. And all of that is important, but we need to remember that our spiritual accomplishments are more important. What we do in school or for a job... that's just a small part of who we are. We're only here by the grace of God, so let's get out there and share that grace. Miguel watches, still unsure what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Anne leads the group in song, while Randy plays the piano Miguel watches; he's the only person not singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One there is above all others, Oh, how He loves! His is love beyond a brother's, Oh, how He loves! Earthly friends may fail or leave us, One day soothe, the next day grieve us; But this Friend will ne'er deceive us: Oh, how He loves! Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel observes, a little disappointed, as this is not qu date he was hoping for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Brad are side by side in neighboring aisle sea while Jorge and Jeff catch some Zs against the window. Mi "English for Baseball Players" workbook is on his lap, bu and Brad discuss language that won't likely be found ther

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MamaГ±ema.    Very bad.   Very bad word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama-Г±ema?    What's it mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm... Like-- Miguel mimes fellatio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cock-sucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we say cocksucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, cocksucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MamaГ±ema. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in bad Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is your favorite player?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in bad English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robinson Cano for the Yankees.    I know him brother. And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberto Clemente.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    60. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    You don't know about Clemente? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Dominican? BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puerto Rican. I can't believe it. This is tragic. Do you know who Babe Ruth is? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Ruth?   El chocolate? Brad stares at Miguel for a beat, and they both crack up. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how'd it go with that girl the other night? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl? BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, didn't you have a date, or something? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she no es my girl. Brad senses Miguel's disappointment in the matter. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sweat, bro. We'll find you a little honey on the road. Miguel smiles.   Brad picks up his mp3 player, searches t for something. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like The White Stripes? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out. Miguel grabs his portable CD player, hands it to Brad, tr music with him. As Miguel places Brad's Bose headphones o his ears, The White Stripes' "Seven Nation Army" infuses soundtrack and leads us through the following... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       61.

dialogues.speaker: EARLY SEASON SWING BASEBALL SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: --The Swing players sprint out of the dugout to their pos at BRIDGETOWN BALLPARK, while Miguel struts to the mound supreme confidence. A122   --AT A VISITING TEAM'S STADIUM, Miguel throws a se strikes and batters WHIFF. B122   --Miguel ices down his arm after a game. C122   --Ed sneaks up behind Miguel while he's talking to drops a handful of ice down his shirt. H122   --AT A VISITING BALL PARK Brad makes a diving stop D122   --AT THEIR HOME PARK, Stu works with Miguel in the afternoon, before the other players have arrived. J122   --Brad slides in safely at second base. F122   --Miguel runs videotape during one of his off days G122   --Jorge strikes out. J122   --Miguel and Jorge eat eggs at a local diner. 123    --AT THE WESTERN UNION, Miguel hands $300 through the teller. 124    --ON THE BUS, Brad hands Miguel a local paper, fea of Miguel on the mound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Santos stings Owls with 8 Ks." What kind of shoddy journalism is this? There's nothing' about me in here. Miguel smiles, takes the paper, examines it. 125    --IN A MOTEL ROOM, Miguel enthusiastically talks o with his mom back home. A125   --AT A VISITING TEAM BALLPARK, Miguel picks off a first. 126    --Jorge does physical therapy for his knee while M stretches out his pitching arm. 127    --Miguel watches videotape of his pitching with St coach's office. A127   --Miguel, Jorge, Orlando and Ed sit in the dugout, listen as a chaplain gives a sermon in Spanish. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the other end of the dugout, some of the American play listen to a Sunday morning sermon in English. B127   --TRACK IN on Miguel as he fires in another strike 128    --A KID hands Miguel a baseball card and pen for h Miguel coolly obliges like he's been doing this for years 129    --IN THE RADIO BOOTH, after a game, Jack Jefferies Miguel with Orlando acting as translator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At what point in the game did you realize you had your best stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doing his best)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you know you were going to be a good pitcher in this game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew from the time I was very young I would be a good pitcher. Ten, eleven years old. Thanks to God, I have had the opportunity to develop my talents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew very early that he was going to pitch good. Eleven years. Jack Jefferies nods, confused.   Miguel and Orlando look other, unsure. END EARLY SEASON SEQUENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel checks his appearance in the bathroom mirror, whil talks on the telephone with somebody back home. Jorge app anguished, as he struggles to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good. Because I haven't been playing good... No. I'm working hard, but, I don't know... I think they might... (Jorge glances back toward Miguel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I can't talk now. Miguel gets the hint, steps out of his room into the... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    63.

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL HALLWAY
dialogues.text: ...and we follow Miguel through the lobby, which opens up an enormous arcade with blinking neon lights, and whistli machines everywhere. His senses on the verge of overload, continues through the arcade, which then opens up into a.

dialogues.speaker: FUN CITY BOWLING ALLEY
dialogues.text: Miguel notices Brad bowling with some GIRLS and other pla Miguel watches for a beat as they laugh at one of the gir gutter balls. He thinks about going over to say hello, bu decides against it, heads back toward the arcade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Jorge sleeps, Miguel carves a small piece of wood w swiss army knife. Stops when he hears a burst of MALE AND FEMALE VOICES coming from down the hall. He, goes to the listens... The drunken giggling VOICES get louder as they approach. looks through the peephole, sees... ...Brad and Jeff with TWO LOCAL GIRLS disappear into thei across the hall. Miguel puts his ear to the door again, but can't hear any so he returns to the desk, begins carving again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando and Ed play a spirited game of Casino on a Gatora in the aisle while Miguel, Jorge and Brad chat about movi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever see "Y Tu Mama Tambien"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y tu mama what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y Tu Mama Tambien... It's Mexican. Jorge laughs, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't know this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are your favorite movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terminator. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Matrisse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Matrisse. Very strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matrisse?   What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know Matrisse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know The Matrisse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mattress? I don't know. (turns to Jeff, beside him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, do you know a movie called The Mattress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mattress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Keanu...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keanu Reeves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!   The MATRIX!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matrisse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, the Matrix is badass.   I was like, Mattress? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes   up a birthday card to his sister Erica, enc in a padded   envelope along with the wooden etching he c earlier - a   pendant with a cornstalk design. The NYC ca on the wall   in the background indicates we are now in J When he's done, he goes to his duffel, pulls out his Engl language workbook. Miguel sits on his bed, opens the book. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A batter swings and misses for strike three.    The catch the ball around the horn. Miguel steps off the mound, grabs the rosin bag for tract gets the ball back. His next pitch is hit on the ground toward the first base where the first baseman makes a nice back-handed play... Miguel sprints over to cover the bag, receives the toss,

dialogues.speaker: OUCH
dialogues.text: ...the RUNNER storms into Miguel before he has time to pu foot off the bag, knocking them both hard to the ground. runner is called out, but Miguel is slow getting to his f Stu and the TRAINER run out to check on him. Jorge rushes from third, and Orlando also comes to help translate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice play, kid.     How's your foot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Miguel nods, but he's limping back to the mound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. Don't force it.     How's it feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't push it. Does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him toss a few warm-ups. The umpire grants Miguel a few "test" pitches. Visibly shaken, Miguel sets up for a warm-up pitch, breat deeply, and delivers. He lands gingerly on his right ankl makes a face. Stu and the trainer exchange glances. Miguel notices this he sets up for another pitch. The trainer shakes his head Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, kid.     Give it a rest. As Stu reaches for the ball, Miguel pulls it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am okay.   Please. Stu and the trainer sense Miguel's anxiety.     Stu puts Miguel's shoulder for comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay, I know, but let's just be sure... Give me the ball, son. Miguel sizes them up, reluctantly hands the ball over, an off the field with Stu and the other players looking afte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole family, with a     couple new additions, sit ar table in mid-meal: Earl,     Helen, Anne, Michael, Hilary Brad and Miguel. Miguel      wears a big blue boot on his foot, and a crutch leans     against the wall behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been pitching so well... it's a real shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Miguel, you'll bounce right back. Miguel pokes at his food, avoids eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you say you were from, Brad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berkeley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, different world out there, huh? You like to surf? Brad smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no, I've never tried it.     But maybe someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your parents visit here? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    67. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hope so. Maybe when they get some time off this summer. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you, Miguel?    What's your family like? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family? ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Like, who do you live with back home? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live with my mother, sister, brother... and Abuela? Miguel looks to Jorge for help. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandmother. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And grandmother. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about your father, Miguel? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father, uh... (searching for the word) He die. Anne nudges her dad under the table. HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Miguel, honey.    I'm so sorry. Miguel nods, takes a bite of potatoes.   There is an awkw as everybody chews. Miguel musters all his language skills to break the awkwa silence. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael and Hilary) You have other child...? HILARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we have a son.   Anne's older brother. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Iraq. Brad pauses from chewing, looks around, and nods.   More silence. Hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Anne sit alone on the porch. We can hear CHATT from inside, where the others are clearing the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it here in Iowa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I like... Many new things. (thinks for a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet. You've traveled a long way, huh? God must have something special in mind for you... Anne points out a small scar on Miguel's scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... When I boy... Um... I don't know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish, no subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... When I was little, I wanted to eat some cherries from a tree. It wasn't our tree, and there was a fence to keep us kids away. Anne hangs on his every word as if she understood perfect

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I climbed up the fence to knock down some cherries with a stick, but I when I took my first swing-- whoosh. I fell. There was a lot of blood. Anne reaches out, lightly touches his scar.   Her hand li for a beat, until... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Miguel leans in and kisses her. She kisses him back fo beat, but when he puts his hand around her waist, pulling closer, she resists. They separate. Anne looks down at her feet, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I just...      Sorry. Miguel looks on, confused, as she stands.   They lock eye awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should help clean up... On her way back inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have another meeting Thursday...    If you can come. Miguel nods. Anne leaves him on the porch alone.     He l over the corn fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel enters the near-empty room limping on his blue boo finds Jorge wearing street clothes and packing up persona things from his locker. Miguel knows immediately what's happened. They make eye contact from across the locker room.   Nobo moves. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a good run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the drill. I'm not playing well, so they'll bring up somebody who is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your knee? You just need some more time... You're recovering. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   70. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugar... Miguel relents. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you leave? JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me to fly back tonight. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight?! JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not going back... A beat as Miguel lets this sink in. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta cousin in New York. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to New York? JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where else? There's no work back home. My bonus won't last forever... Miguel looks off.    Jorge senses his anxiety. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax Sugar, I'll see you at Yankee Stadium someday... when the Knights come to town. I'll be in the front row, getting drunk, and cheering the loudest. Miguel smiles. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for you though. Yankee fans are crazy. I can't take the risk... I'll call you. A beat as Miguel looks at Jorge with concern.    Jorge sh off. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worry too much, Sugar. I'll be okay. I mean, it's just a game, right? Miguel nods. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A140   Sofia on the phone. We INTERCUT between her and Mi BEDROOM, his injured ankle elevated on a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you play tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you have lots of groupies waiting for you after your games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding. I mean I would, but none of these white girls speak Spanish. Marcos plays in Arizona. Lots of Mexicans; everyone speaks Spanish. He has like fifteen girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably lying though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he's lying. A beat, as Miguel shifts gears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge went to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Yankees?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Our team cut him loose. He's got a cousin there... I don't know what he's going to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...    What about his family? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his mind somewhere else)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not right. He got injured playing for them. They owe him another chance. He's worked too hard for too long... I mean he's not a horse. Miguel drifts off, and they sit in silence for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't let it get to you. You've got nothing to worry about. Just keep playing well, and things will be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...   I know. Things will be okay. Miguel looks off, not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Players lounge in uniform, relaxing before tonight's game reads on the sofa across from Miguel, who is in his stree clothes, his crutch by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Terrordome.   It's about sports and politics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You study at, um, university?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I went to Stanford. Studied history and baseball. Did you go to school back in the DR?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Little. Secondaria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   A little of... high school.   But I sign when I have sixteen years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You signed at sixteen?   Wow.   So you didn't finish school? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel shakes his head, no.    After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you no play baseball... what you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... it's hard to say for sure, but I like history, so I'd probably go to grad school... maybe teach someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad!   We're up for B.P.   Let's go. Brad gets up, taps Miguel on the shoulder on his way out. Miguel sits alone on the couch in the empty room, when he off, sees... IN THE BATHROOM doorway-- Jeff Elks discreetly hands ANOT PLAYER a prescription pill bottle, exits. Miguel takes note of the transaction, leans back, looks a ceiling fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel watches "When the Levees Broke" playing on HBO-Lat ON THE TV, one image of the hurricane's devastation gives another. An AFRICAN-AMERICAN WOMAN stranded on the roof o house. A YOUNG BOY who's lost his mother. Miguel looks on, moved by the tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel takes the initiative and attempts to do his own la while on the disabled list. He stuffs his clothes into the washer, scrutinizes the instructions, turns the knobs, and presses the buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel studies his English Language workbook on the couch glances at the wall clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Miguel opens the faulty utensils drawer, the folded pa towel holding it in place pops out. Miguel catches the dr from slipping too far, takes out a fork. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel sits at the kitchen table with the broken drawer a several small tools in front of him. He readjusts the woo rails on the faulty side of the drawer by sanding them do re-gluing them into place. KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK. FRONT DOOR. Miguel hobbles over, opens it to find Anne, carrying a casserole dish and a couple empty platters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are grandma's from the other night. Miguel lets her pass into the kitchen, put the dishes on table. They stand awkwardly for a beat, looking at each o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We missed you at our meeting, Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.    I forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, maybe next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go actually, so--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, go. Miguel sits, gets back to work on the drawer.    Anne loo for a second, then exits. Miguel glances out the window, watches Anne climb into a truck idling in the driveway. Anne and Miguel make brief contact before the truck speeds away, a trail of dust fol it into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel walks down a path in the middle of the Higgins' co field. He finds a cob of corn, removes the leaves, and ex the kernels up close. ZOOM IN to ECU of a single kernel. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel stares at the raw corn with strange fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel walks in without crutches, looking healthy. He pou few players hello, then freezes upon seeing Brad's empty Stu approaches Miguel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an injury to the Wichita right-fielder. They called up Brad this morning... He left you this... Stu hands Miguel an old paperback book. INSERT: a Spanish-language version of Roberto Clemente's biography. Miguel opens to the first page, where Brad has inscribed a note, "See you in Kansas City, MamaГ±ema!" Miguel smiles, bittersweet, when a familiar VOICE calls o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo!   Sugar! Miguel turns around to find Salvador Torres (the once scr kid from the Academy) running at him. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!     How'd you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a airplane, motherfucker. Miguel playfully flips Salvador's cap bill down over his for being a smartass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, you guys know each other. Sal's our new middle-relief man. Throws a nasty cutter. You could learn a thing or two from him, Santos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Stu walks back towards the coaches' office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he say? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not sure himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it... Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, too, Sugar. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, just remember... it's the same game we played back home. Same rules, different place. Just have fun. It's only a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Miguel swearing at himself, clearly not followin own advice. A RUNNER circles the bases after hitting a homerun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santos allows his second homerun of the game.   First night off the DL, and not looking so sharp. The SCOREBOARD indicates the Swing losing 5-2 in the 4th. Miguel glances out of the corner of his eye to...

dialogues.speaker: THE DUGOUT
dialogues.text: ...Stu is scribbling on his scorecard. MIGUEL quickly sets up for his next pitch, but Stu is on out to the mound. Miguel glances back to the bullpen, whe Salvador is warming up. Stu signals for Salvador to come in, and we follow Miguel the field to scattered applause. A148   IN THE RADIO BOOTH Jack Jefferies continues his pl the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sutton makes the call to pull Santos here in the 4th, bringing in rookie reliever, Salvador Torres for his Bridgetown debut. B148   IN THE DUGOUT.   Miguel sits on the bench, throws his head. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MOUND.   Salvador warms up, looking a little freak Players and fans marvel over Sal's unorthodox, side-armed delivery. His form is reminiscent of A's legend, Dennis Eckersly, but without the grace. MIGUEL peaks through his towel at the action... ON THE FIELD.   Salvador takes a deep breath, delivers hi pitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike! Salvador seems to relax.    Winds up his next pitch, and. ...the ball appears to zig-zag across the plate, freezing hitter in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike two! MIGUEL can't watch, hides behind the towel again.   SLOW on Miguel's head, hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike THREE! Miguel removes the towel, sees... ...SALVADOR smiling big as he comes off the field. Orland him on the back, hands him his first professional strikeo ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stellar debut for Torres, who records the final out, baffling Josh Lansford with a nasty side-armed cutter. D148   FROM THE DUGOUT, Salvador arrives to a congratulat ovation from the fans and his teammates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to America, kid. Salvador sits next to Miguel on the bench, admiring the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do me a favor... don't give it away to the first white girl you meet. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvador laughs, but Miguel is serious.   He gets up and for the showers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen and Earl drive Miguel home after the game. ON THE C RADIO, we can hear a news report of a suicide bombing in Helen turns it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You started dropping your arm in the third. I think that was your problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lost control of his breaking pitches and they just zeroed in on the fastball, which isn't as fast as it used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't matter, he can't understand anyway. Miguel stares out the window in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON corn stalks passing through frame. Miguel stares the bus window. Salvador jokes around with Orlando and Ed whether Dominican or Venezuelan girls are better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel tries to sleep, while Salvador watches "Sponge Bob the Spanish channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel walks out onto the field, notices Stu working with Salvador in the bullpen. Out of nowhere, Stu mimes the ch walk to Sal, and they both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel runs videotape behind homeplate as Salvador strike batter out. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel throws in a pitch, which is lined directly over hi for a base hit. He swears to himself as he sprints over t up home plate where the runner scores easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel storms into the empty clubhouse, grabs a bat from wall rack, and smashes a water dispenser unit to the grou spilling water everywhere. As he observes the mess, his breathing steadies, and... He glances over to the entrance, where the clubhouse mana stares at him, disapproving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel sits across from Stu, staring off, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's hard when you don't perform up to your own expectations for yourself. But you need to learn self- control. Can you understand what I'm saying? You need to learn that your actions have consequences. So we're gonna take the cost of the water unit you broke out of your next check... That's not something your family back home's gonna be too proud of... Is it? Miguel turns his gaze to Stu. Though he doesn't fully understand what he's saying, Stu's intention is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you should think real hard next time. Think about channeling that frustration you're feeling onto the field. Into practice. Channel it into working harder--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I am work hard! Everyday I work hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So work harder, goddamnit! You think you're the only one on this team works hard? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand you. You speak too fast. I just don't understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you may think I don't know what you're going through, but I do. I've been on the mound; I've played through pain. I've been in your exact situation before. I've struggled too... I've... As Miguel glances away in frustration, Stu stops himself. sit in silence. Hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pouring rain. The few remaining FANS head for the exits. players pack up their gear in their respective dugouts. SLOW ZOOM IN on MIGUEL, staring at the falling rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON about ten pills in Miguel's palm. Jeff Elks instructs Miguel, alone, in the small room with flickering fluorescent light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, your first time, take a half. Okay? No more. You gotta ease into it. Half. Miguel nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And anyone finds these, you didn't get them from me, okay? Before Miguel can respond, Salvador enters with his dirty laundry. Miguel hides the pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Sal? Jeff heads out.    Miguel resumes folding his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear I made player of the week? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me last night. Salvador examines his detergent options from the dispense machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one do you use? Miguel eyes the bleach.    Can't help himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Salvador inserts coins into the machine, pulls the bleach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel pops two pills.    Exits out into the...

dialogues.speaker: SWING CLUBHOUSE
dialogues.text: ...where Salvador undresses out of his bleach-stained str clothes. Miguel walks past without acknowledging him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA eerily floats toward and around Miguel on the He stares down the HITTER, totally focused. He touches hi cross, whispers a prayer to himself. Winds up, throws, and...

dialogues.speaker: THUD
dialogues.text: ...a cloud of dust pops off the catcher's mitt, just like old days. Miguel's "stuff" is back. And he knows it. A161   IN THE STANDS. Earl and Helen settle into their bo eating caramel corn and cola. B161   RADIO ANNOUNCERS BOOTH.    Jack Jefferies at the m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel Santos appears to be in top form tonight, striking out two of three in the first. I don't want to jinx it, but this sure looks like the Santos we knew earlier this season. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C161   IN THE DUGOUT. There's an intensity we haven't see Miguel. We get the sense he's treating this game like it be his last.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOUND
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MIGUEL.    Sweating more than he should at this the game, but... ...who cares? He continues to dominate opposing hitters, striking out two more in the 2nd. A162   IN THE STANDS.   Earl and Helen CHEER for their Mi

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DUGOUT
dialogues.text: Still sweating, Miguel is now shifting his jaw back-and-f The SOUND FADES LOW, as he stares onto the field, sees... ...the teams changing sides between innings, everyone mov subtle SLOW-MOTION (36 fps). Stu approaches Miguel, puts his hand on his shoulder. We him mouth the words, "You okay?", but NO SOUND comes out. Miguel nods, yes.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: And back in real time (24 fps). Miguel fires his first pi over the head of his catcher and all the way to the backs Orlando motions for him to calm down. The next pitch is closer, but still high. And the next pitch BEANS the hitter in the thigh. Miguel swears at himself, tries hard to calm down, but hi is racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top of the fifth and Santos is showing some control issues. Not sure what's going on down there, but he seems to be talking to himself. B164   ON THE MOUND, Orlando runs out to Miguel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. You're all good. Just relax. Throw strikes. They can't touch you. Just throw strikes. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel nods.   Orlando goes back behind the plate. Miguel glances to the runner at first, then delivers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike! Orlando nods, encouraging.      Throws the ball back. Miguel takes another deep breath. He whispers a prayer to himself, grabs the ball in his spike curve grip, and... ...his next pitch is ROCKED to deep left field. Miguel immediately lowers his head, unable to watch. We H his anguished reaction, as the hitter circles the bases. STU shakes his head in disappointment. C164   FROM THE BULLPEN, Salvador watches, concerned. D164   FROM THE STANDS, Earl and Helen clap for encourage E164   MIGUEL does his best to shake it off, but he keeps himself, which makes him look crazy. Another deep breath.    Another pitch... UH-OH. This one almost finds the batter's head, as he falls to t to avoid contact. It's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ejecting Miguel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're outta here! The batter leaps to his feet, walks out toward the mound, pointing his finger at Miguel, PISSED. Miguel opens his arms, inviting a fight.     Orlando step them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Puerto Rican piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, cocksucker! Both benches clear, as players rush out onto the field to restore order. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and the batter continue jawing at each other, whil other players swirl around them, creating little sub-conf of their own. It's a mess. The sound FADES TO SILENCE and the image blends to SLO-MO There's something poetic about a bunch of men in child-li baseball uniforms, screaming at each other in silence. Miguel looks around, perhaps recognizing this for himself Hold, until... ...he calmly walks off the field, leaving the chaos behin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel showers alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel eats a late dinner at the table. Earl sits at the end, sipping some tea, while Helen does dishes at the sin The mood is uncomfortably tense. Nobody says a word, unti Miguel musters up the courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Helen turns off the faucet, turns around. Earl methodical sets down his mug, stands up, and crosses to Miguel. Puts arm around his shoulder, wherein... ...Miguel breaks down, hugs Earl around the waist, his fa pressed against his stomach. He's crying. Hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu addresses Miguel before the game. Though his words ar encouraging, his tone is detached, cold. Miguel senses th listens, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You played with your emotions, and your emotions got the best of you. Happens to everyone. It's just a nasty part of the game. Nobody likes to admit it, but it is. The true test of our character as athletes... is how we come back. It's up to you. Stu notices Hardy, the Swing mascot, pass by his office d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy! Don't wander off; I gotta talk to you about that accountant... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel sits out in the bullpen with the other relievers, Stu continues in V.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, um, anyway, I'm bumping Sal into your slot in the rotation. I'd like to see how you handle a relief spot. A168   ON THE MOUND, Salvador fires in the opening pitch. B168   IN THE RADIO BOOTH, Jack Jefferies does his play b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving up from relief, Torres makes his third start for the Swing. I tell ya, this lanky kid from the Dominican Republic has surprised us all with his unique delivery and precision. Reminds me of a young Pedro Martinez... Hey there Bees fans, don't forget, closing night is approaching fast and tickets are selling out. So pick yours up at the box office today...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Similar to an earlier sequence of JUMPCUTS on Miguel reac the game from the dugout, we now HOLD on Miguel, solemn a detached, from the bullpen. NOTE: the frame for the following images contains the fir rows of FANS seated behind the bullpen, so we can also us to gauge what might be happening on the field. PLAY 1: Miguel, the FOUR RELIEVERS, and the fans clap for nice play. PLAY 2: The fans jump to their feet as a ground ball pass through frame, followed by an outfielder in hot pursuit. PLAY 3: A reliever warms up in the foreground. Miguel sta ahead, deadpan, while the others chat and spit chewing to PLAY 4: A new reliever warms up, then runs out onto the f leaving only two others with Miguel. PLAY 5: Miguel stares ahead, while the crowd does the "Ch Dance" behind him. PLAY 6: The fans leap to their feet in applause. The two relievers high-five. Miguel CLAPS, going through the moti Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07         86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLAY 7: Miguel chews and spits sunflower seed shells as t fans sing along to "Take Me Out to the Ball Game." PLAY 8: Another reliever runs out onto the field, leaving Miguel and one other guy. PLAY 9:   Miguel is finally warming up, ready to enter th but... ...the fans leap to their feet, CHEERING victoriously. Ga over. The only other reliever grabs his jacket, and heads onto the field. As the players and fans   head for the exits, Miguel rema the bullpen mound for a   beat. He nods to himself, oddly peace with the moment.    Miguel steps off the mound and with him, as he crosses   frame, and makes the long walk dugout. Hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel grabs a slip of paper from his nightstand. His lar duffel bag is packed full in front of him. On the wall, h calendar is turned to AUGUST. He goes to the phone.   Dials... After a long beat he hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen walks in to find Miguel washing the dishes in the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, you don't have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his English better than ever)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. I want to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you, Miguel. Helen grabs a dish towel.      They do the dishes togethe silence. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Helen. Helen smiles, pats Miguel on the back.     HOLD. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl drops off Miguel near the team bus, as players and c load their gear in, and get on. Miguel cautiously approaches the bus, sees Salvador, hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot something in the clubhouse. I'll be right back. As Miguel turns, Salvador grabs his bag, which is still o shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I'll load your bag. Miguel grips his bag tighter and the two of them lock eye Salvador senses his intensity, releases the bag. Miguel b away with Salvador looking on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathroom. AT THE CLUBHOUSE ENTRANCE Miguel turns back to the bus, s ...Salvador eyeing him from the open bus window.   Sal ra hand, very subtly waves goodbye. Miguel continues on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A local taxi pulls up, and Miguel hops out with his duffe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel steps on, moves past the other PASSENGERS, finds a seat towards the back. He sits down, catches his breath, whispers a prayer to himself. When he's done, he looks ac the aisle, where an OLD LADY is staring at him. He shoots her a cautious smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel stares, wide-eyed, out the window at the shifting landscapes, daytime into evening... --cornstalks. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --bridges and rivers. --city lights. He sleeps against the window, his Clemente book open on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the New Jersey turnpike, Miguel sees the approaching Manhattan skyline in the early morning light. He sits up straight, looks attentively at the city emerging in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning COMMUTERS push past Miguel, as he looks around, l the cacophony of the swirling rush hour environment. He locates a giant subway map on the wall, the various su lines reaching into the outer boroughs like colorful tent His eyes scan the map, and we follow his finger up the gr line's numbered stations, stopping on 161ST/YANKEE STADIU Miguel smiles. AT THE TURNSTILES. Miguel inches forward, observes people passing through after swiping cards. He notices a line be Metrocard vending machine nearby.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE MACHINE
dialogues.text: Fortunately, there is a Spanish option, so after a few to and BEEPS, he's got his card.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TURNSTILE
dialogues.text: He swipes the card, tries to pass through, but the turnst won't budge. He studies the message: "SWIPE AGAIN AT THIS TURNSTILE", but can't make sense of it. Miguel tries agai this time very slowly, but still can't get through. An IMPATIENT COMMUTER behind him SIGHS loudly. Miguel steps out of the way, let's the commuter pass. After the commuter goes through, Miguel tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Miguel strolls through the underground hallway that co the various Times Square subway lines, he sees... --a TEAM OF BREAKDANCERS performing for tips. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --billboard ads for movies, music, dermatologists, Mets baseball, etc. --a HOMELESS MAN passed out on the ground. --a WOMAN selling a random collection of objects: VHS tap batteries, a used blender...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel observes other passengers, when the train emerges ground. He stands, looks out the window as the train pass Yankee Stadium.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 167TH ST.
dialogues.text: Miguel descends from the elevated subway station, glances around. The atmosphere is immediately more familiar, as P walk by speaking Spanish; MERENGUE blasts out of an open apartment window; Dominican flags hang from others. Miguel paces up the block, looking for something.    He s when he finds... ...El Restaurante Caribe. A HELP WANTED sign (in English Spanish) hangs in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel takes a seat at the counter, smiles to the waitres REYNA (cute, 20-something, Dominican).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish, of course)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Jorge working today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge Ramirez. A bus boy, RAFAEL, overhears as he passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge, the ball player!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. The ballpayer... He left about two weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he drives a car now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a phone number for him? His old one isn't working. Reyna shrugs, looks to Rafael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... But I think he was staying down at concourse village on 156th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still comes in to eat sometimes. Miguel nods, looks off, a little anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel glances up at the dozens of high-rise apartment bu in every direction. He walks away, discouraged.

dialogues.speaker: EXT., (ANOTHER)
dialogues.text: Miguel continues to follow the elevated subway tracks, wh lead him straight to... ...YANKEE STADIUM. He looks up at the park's grand exteri with wonder. Approaches to get a closer look. The Stadium is closed today, so Miguel struggles to catch glimpse of the field through an iron fence. He grabs hold the bars, attempts to climb just enough to get a better v but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanta see the inside, you gotta buy a ticket, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his duffel on his lap, Miguel sits on a bench overlo a community baseball field, where local KIDS play for fun stares off blankly, preoccupied with other things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel stands before the old transient hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel sidesteps a nodding JUNKY on his way to the front approaches the toothless Russian clerk, NIKOLAI (late 50s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred a week.   First week in advance. As Miguel tries to piece together what was just said, he a rack of condoms beside a set of long distance calling c the front desk. The name of the calling card is ALГ“ MAMГ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred now. Miguel reaches for the calling card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This also please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Miguel looks for his room, he passes another room's do where a middle-aged JOHN gives a woman a kiss goodbye. Mi makes brief eye contact with the woman, RAQUEL. She smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel turns on the light to find a small bed in the corn the room. There's also a desk with a phone. Miguel puts d his duffel and sits at the desk. He examines the calling for a beat, then goes to the window, looks out. Hold. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel strolls by various stores and restaurants. He pass outside a WOODEN CABINET STORE, where 5-6 Dominican men, in age from 20 to 50 years old, make furniture in the sho stops for a beat, watching the men work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel approaches a man, OSVALDO (late 50s), who works at desk on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak Spanish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    Can I help you? Miguel glances around at the various wooden furniture ite sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.    What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, I mean... I don't know. I was passing by and thought maybe you might need some help. I know how to make furniture, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I don't have any work right now. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.    Okay, thanks for your time. Osvaldo gets back to his computer, but Miguel lingers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know any other places like this where I might find work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you checked the classifieds? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel sips soda from a straw as he leafs through the classifieds in a Spanish-language daily. INSERT: Various employment ads, requiring experience, flu English, working papers, etc. Miguel glances up, stares out the window. Rafael, the bus from the other day, wipes down the table next to Miguel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you leave a number, I'll give it to him next time he comes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel braces himself, dials on the phone, waits... His N calendar (turned to the Statue of Liberty month) hangs on wall in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica? A194   We INTERCUT between Miguel and his home in the Dom Republic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel!   My God, where are you? Carmen snatches the phone from Erica, who stays close, tr listen in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguelito, what is going on? Frank called last night. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! What are you doing in New York? I don't understand. Your team is looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't play anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? What does that mean, you can't play? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   94. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I'm fine. It just-- CARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been working for this your whole life, Miguelito. Oh, my God! You're so close. I don't understand... MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, mom. I have some money. We're going to be okay. CARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to go back. Listen, Miguel, my sweet sugar, call Frank. They'll take you back. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back-- CARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I raise you like this?    Did I raise you to give up? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't give up. I'm starting something new here. CARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   What are you starting? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go mom. The card's almost out of minutes. CARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you even staying?   Miguel-- MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'm staying with a friend. I have a new job. It's all good. I'm sending money tomorrow. CARMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel-- MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.    I'm sorry. Miguel hangs up, stares off. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS past a long line of IMMIGRANTS in all shape sizes, preparing to wire money back home, wherever that i MINUTES LATER. Miguel looks at the few bills in his walle hands two fifties to the TELLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel leans over the counter, talks to Reyna, the waitre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, um, I was in here the other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, did you find your guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm actually looking for a job today. She smiles, calls over to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fernando! (leans close to Miguel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him you like his shirt. Reyna moves away, and Miguel glances over to the approach MANAGER. He's wearing an outrageously colorful tropical s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Miguel's hand scraping uneaten food into the tra His new co-worker, RAFAEL (the same bus boy from Miguel's visit), shows Miguel how to use the dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then put it in here with the others. Miguel puts the plate in the large dish washer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it's full, set to scrub, and there it is. Miguel stares at the machine as it HUMS and WHIRS. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Rafael sit next to each other in the back, eat dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know anybody with a room for rent? Rafael shakes his head, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'll ask around, let you know if I hear of anything. Miguel nods, gets back to his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Jorge used to play baseball together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you like baseball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'd rather watch soccer though... Have you found him yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be through sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you worked here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have family here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. My wife and kids are still in Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family's in the Dominican. Rafael nods, and they continue eating. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud, overexaggerated SEX SOUNDS filter in from another r while Miguel reads the last page of the Clemente biograph After a beat, he closes the book, listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two EMPLOYEES say goodbye to Osvaldo as Miguel enters the Miguel approaches Osvaldo, who is sanding a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, um, do you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but, sorry, I still don't have a job for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. I already found one. I'm actually just trying to make a coffee table, and I'd like to buy some wood and supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really sell raw materials... Miguel hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just moved here, you know, and I don't have a space to work. Do you think I could do some work for you, help you clean up or whatever you need, in exchange for using your shop? You don't have to pay me. Osvaldo sizes up Miguel's unusual request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody paying you for the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's a gift for my mom.   Something I like to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who taught you to make tables? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   98. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad.     He was a carpenter in San Pedro. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that where you're from? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I grew up in Santiago.    What are you doing in New York? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to work. I used to play baseball. Osvaldo nods, understanding. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole world plays baseball. My son's sixteen. Won't touch a piece of wood that's not a bat. I never cared for the game, myself. Too slow. Miguel laughs. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom still in San Pedro? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    With my sister and brother. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're telling me that you want to make a table for your mom, then mail it back to her in the Dominican? Miguel nods.   Osvaldo smiles, finally warming up. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel. They shake hands. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osvaldo. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel performs his new work routine: mopping floors, was dishes, accepting deliveries. He seems to be getting the of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Miguel eats from a heaping plate of beef and mashed yu watches Reyna chatting up a customer from behind the coun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel passes a Western Union, looks inside, but keeps go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel finishes work on his table for the night, covers i a blanket, and proceeds to sweep up. Osvaldo works at his desktop computer from across the room. They don't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel sits at the desk, talks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Is Sofia at home?... Yeah, it's Miguel again... Can you tell her... Just tell her I called... Miguel hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel leans against the counter, staring at his clothes twirling in the dryer, when... ...he notices Raquel unloading her clothes a few dryers a She pushes her laundry cart to the opposite side of his c begins folding. Miguel stares at her out of the corner of his eye, taking special notice of her diverse underwear collection rangin lacy thongs to the standard cotton variety. She catches h peeking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a mysterious Eastern- European accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just going to watch or you going to help me out? Caught off guard, Miguel smiles awkwardly, turns away. few beats, a flying sock lands on his shoulder. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to find several random items of her clothin the counter in front of him. She smiles, keeps folding. Miguel sorts through the items: socks, underwear, t-shirt looks back to her, then begins folding, as the laundromat machinery reverberates around them. They exchange brief g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukraine. Miguel nods, and they continue folding in silence.    Hol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel carves wood, while Osvaldo looks on from his desk. exchange glances, until Miguel breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you never liked baseball?    Not even as a kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Sometimes during the playoffs I'll watch a game or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your favorite player?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know enough to have a favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, everybody has a favorite player: Juan Marichal, Pedro Martinez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.    Jose Canseco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jose Canseco!? That's the best you can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberto Clemente.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing his buttons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of him. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   101. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so special about Clemente? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read this book where he said something like, "If you have the opportunity to help someone and don't, then you're wasting your life." And he was a carpenter too. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real. He used to make furniture during the off season. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking with me? Cause you know I can google this fool right now. MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Google? OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The internet. Don't worry, I'll teach you someday. A beat.   Miguel continues his work. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you get released? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't release me. I left a few days before the season ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left?    When was this? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About two weeks ago. OSVALDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.   Where are you staying? MIGUEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, with a friend. But if you know somebody who needs a roommate... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07        102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osvaldo nods and they continue working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you leave? Miguel hesitates, unsure where to begin.      Osvaldo sen discomfort with the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any family here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm okay... I have some money saved, a couple friends. I'll go home to visit soon. Osvaldo doesn't quite buy it, but nods anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know a place called Ukraine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel attempts to slip past Nikolai, who is currently ch in another GUEST, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   You owe money.   Full week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.    I have tomorrow.   No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, problem. You pay tomorrow or you have big problem. Miguel continues up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to sleep, Miguel lies in bed, staring at the ceili when he overhears a commotion from across the hall. After a beat, he hears a door open and SLAM SHUT. He goes to the door, listens close.     It's quiet, until

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK
dialogues.text: Miguel flinches.    Then slowly cracks open the door to f ...Raquel standing before him with a small leather duffel Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him the bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love, keep this in your room for me. Just a few hours. Til morning. I'll be back. She forces the bag into his hands, kisses him on the chee retreats into her own room. Miguel closes the door, still holding the bag. He sets it his bed, stares at it. After a few beats, he grabs it, st it under the bed, out of sight. He sits down at the desk, stares at the bed, when he hear SHOUTING from the hall. Again, he goes to the door, liste Another MAN POUNDS on Raquel's door, SCREAMING in Ukraini while Nikolai YELLS at the man in English, though Miguel make out exactly what's going on. The shouting intensifie until a SCUFFLE breaks out. A woman SCREAMS. Miguel reach for the door handle, but stops himself. He steps into his BATHROOM, shuts the door, sits on the t The muffled SHOUTING continues. Miguel waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now quiet, Miguel stares at the mysterious bag on his bed heads for the door with his packed duffel over his should puts his ear to the door, then exits, leaving the other b behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel tip-toes down the hall. He stops in front of Raque room, leans down, and slides his room key under her door. Continues down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel dials his calling card number into the phone, list

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank... It's Miguel. We hold on Miguel, though we can hear Frank's muffled voi through the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Miguel, what the hell happened? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for calling late.    I'm in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard. You're making me look bad. What are you doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a job, but I don't know if I'm going to stay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you gonna go? The season's over... Your visa's expired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I thought maybe I could... A beat, as Miguel drifts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can talk to Alvarez... But I don't know. Nobody's happy about this. Miguel bites his lip.   A police SIREN flies by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Miguel-- Miguel hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, we see Miguel seated at a corner tabl stares out at the early morning traffic.

dialogues.speaker: EARLY MORNING -
dialogues.text: Miguel is asleep at the same table. A WAITRESS comes by w fresh pot of coffee, wakes him up. He declines another cu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Miguel goes through his usual work routine: bu tables, washing dishes, stocking the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel approaches Osvaldo with his duffel bag.     He loo Osvaldo glances up from his work. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Miguel. Miguel doesn't respond. Osvaldo notices his packed bag an expression. Both men stare at each other for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where to go. Osvaldo approaches, takes the duffel from Miguel's should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wearing a Fall coat, Miguel crosses the street on his work, when...

dialogues.speaker: BEEEEEEP
