dialogues.text: ...he's startled by a loud car horn coming from a black l cab parked at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving the finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, man! Miguel keeps walking, but stops upon hearing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you too, bro! Miguel turns to find Jorge, leaping out of his car, and r at him. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been looking for you for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Rafi said you took my old job. Welcome to New York!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge eats at the counter, while Miguel stands on the opp side, in his apron. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called the Higgins to give my new number, but they said you split. I couldn't believe it, man, I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things got a little ugly after you left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all go through slumps you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a slump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I wasn't gonna wait around for them to throw me out. Jorge looks at Miguel for a tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, man, you wouldn't be saying that shit if you made it. Miguel smiles, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from across the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugar! Rafi needs you in the kitchen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They call you Sugar? On his way to the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say? The name sticks. As Miguel slips past Reyna on his way to the kitchen, the exchange flirtatious smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merengue fuels the packed club tonight, as the mostly Lat crowd gets down on the dance floor. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE BAR. Miguel, Reyna, Jorge, and his girlfriend, MON drink beers, enjoying the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got all kinds in this league, bro. Like fat cats in their forties, kids like you and me, Dominicans, Puerto Ricans, even some white boys. I got this fifty year old catcher on my team, used to play for the Dodgers. Can't run for shit, but he's out there every week. Belly out to here. My man can still go deep though... You ever hear from that kid, Brad? Reyna leans close to Miguel, says something in his ear, a smiles, as she leads him out onto...

dialogues.speaker: THE DANCEFLOOR
dialogues.text: ...where they carve up some fast and fierce moves. Miguel wide, having a great time. At this point the sound FADES and the image blends to SLOW-MOTION, their bodies gliding through the frame, soothing and peaceful. Hold, as Jeff Buckley's "Hallelujah" FADES UP and carries over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DELIVERY MAN puts boxes on a ramp, which go from his tr down into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel takes the boxes off the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel and Reyna eat together, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel hands the teller two fifty dollar bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel floats down the street among a packed block of Bro pedestrians. He blends in now, just another face in the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osvaldo helps Miguel work on his coffee table. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osvaldo teaches Miguel how to use the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel, Osvaldo, and his wife, ESTELLA, eat dinner at the The music continues under the following scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did some research and I got a new favorite player now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic Power.    You know him? Miguel shakes his head, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ought to. Greatest Puerto Rican first baseman ever. But that's not why he's my favorite player... Back when he first arrived, 1951, 52, he was playing in the minors. Little Rock, Arkansas. So the story goes, one day before a game, Vic stops into this diner for lunch. Hadn't been here long, so he knew very little English. Didn't even notice the "whites only" sign hanging in the window. And Vic was Black. I looked him up on Google. I mean Black like you. So he sits down at the counter and the little waitress comes up to big Vic and says, "I'm sorry, we don't serve colored people." Osvaldo pauses for dramatic effect, as Miguel and Estella eagerly await what comes next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he leans close to the waitress, tells her in his best English, "That's okay, I don't eat colored people." After a beat, Estella laughs, but Miguel is unsure.   Osv does his best to explain the joke in Spanish. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A229   We INTERCUT between Miguel and Carmen in the DOMIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits at her table in the same old house. (We can see through the window that the new one is still unfinished).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the photos you sent, but you'll have to send more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, mom, but you know it would be a lot easier if you opened an email account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Email? I don't even know how to use the TV! Miguel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making a new table for you.    It's going to be real nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I'll love it.     Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Erica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's good. Got a job at the factory. Just part-time, though, so she can keep up with school. Miguel removes the phone from his ear for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Luis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pitching now. You should see him, Miguel, got an arm like his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but can he throw a knuckle curve? Carmen laughs.    After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you, mom. But, I'm working hard. I'll be home soon. Give everyone a hug for me. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Sugar. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too. She nods, hangs up, and looks over to... ...LITTLE LUIS, watching her from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a Dominican flag being waved by a TODDLER. A WID ANGLE reveals him in the packed bleachers with a diverse of FANS and FRIENDS: Dominicans, Puerto Ricans, Anglos... The mood is festive. A VENDOR sells mangos on sticks. Mer MUSIC blasts from a portable stereo in the stands. FANS d Presidente beer out of bottles.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: Uniformed PLAYERS of all ages, races, shapes, and sizes w before the game (though the majority are Dominican). Jorge introduces Miguel (also in uniform) to the other pl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caballo!   This is Miguel from San Pedro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new guy. You ready to pitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a while, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry; he's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge introduces Miguel to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felipe!    Meet Miguel.   They call him Sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Sugar? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felipe played for the Dodgers Triple-A team. Hit a dinger off Pedro once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More intros...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I played for the Yankees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Padres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kansas City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too!    Bridgetown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there in 96. I lived on a farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the Higgins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Miguel smiles big, just as the UMPIRE calls out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vamos!    Let's play ball!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOUND
dialogues.text: We TILT UP from his cleats to reveal Miguel looking in fo sign from his catcher. He nods. And delivers. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       112. The ball is SMACKED toward third, where Jorge makes an aw lunge for the ball, manages to stop it with his foot.
